meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>tighten</kanji> so the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to tighten</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: You go <vocabulary>to tighten</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to tie</vocabulary> your captive up, and you realize you don't have anything to do it with. Then you see a sheep standing nearby. Okay. You take the <reading>shee</reading>p (し), pull its wool, and tie the sheep and your captive up together around a tree. Problem solved!
